references.paper_title: Deep residual learning for image recognition
references.reason: This paper introduced the ResNet architecture, a crucial component in many modern image classification models, including those used for comparison in the current study.
This paper is foundational to the field of domain generalization, a key topic of the current research and a major factor influencing the approach proposed in this paper.

references.paper_title: Quantprob: Generalizing probabilities along with predictions for a pre-trained classifier
references.reason: This paper directly addresses a similar problem of improving generalization across distributions, using quantile-based probabilities, informing the current research's approach to quantile activation.

references.paper_title: Dinov2: Learning robust visual features without supervision
references.reason: This paper introduces DINOv2, a state-of-the-art self-supervised learning model, used as a key baseline for comparison in evaluating the robustness and generalization capabilities of the proposed method.

references.paper_title: Visual adaptation: Neural, psychological and computational aspects
references.reason: This paper provides a foundational understanding of neural adaptation, a concept relevant to the proposed method's approach of adapting neurons to context distributions.
